mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Jefferson predicts a dramatic series of events in Europe, including a continent-wide series of republican revolutions; the United States and Great Britain will profit by engaging in commerce with the new governments, and those two nations will bolster their mutual friendship; Jefferson's arm has healed but lingering swelling in his hand renders it useless.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1823 March 28, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to [William Short], n.p.
